index.app_description: Free Pomodoro timer right in your browser

img.screenshot: Screenshot of a timer running in AnotherPomodoro

features.title: Focused, clean interface
features.description: Just your timer, the essential controls and a bunch of customizations

features.title: Nothing to install
features.description: Runs in your browser, entirely offline after launch

features.title: Free & open-source
features.description: No hidden trackers, everyone can view and contribute to the code

subtitle.main: {appname} helps you keep track of your time.
subtitle.sub: Just work or take a break when it says so.

cards.title: Short pause
cards.description: Watch a video, read an article, drink a coffee

cards.title: Long pause
cards.description: Take a nap or go for a walk

change_timers.a: Absolutely! You can change the work, pause and long pause timers to whatever you want! You can also change how frequent long pauses are!

will_it_help.a: That depends on you. This app tries hard to create a motivating environment with its clean design and flexibility, but it's up to you whether you follow the schedule it gives you.
will_it_help.hint: If you realize you can't work 25 minutes straight or a break of 5 minutes is too short, adjust them to something more comfortable. Don't give up, follow a more relaxed schedule and progressively go stricter.

data_collection.a: Nope! The app runs only in your browser, no data is being collected or sent anywhere!

remember_settings.q: How will it remember my settings then?
remember_settings.a: It relies on your browser to do that. If you clear your browser data, the app's settings will revert to their defaults, too.
remember_settings.hint: If you want to keep your settings, don't use the app in private browsing (incognito mode).

need_to_know.q: So what do I need to know to use this app?
need_to_know.a: Absolutely nothing. If you don't want to delve into the settings, just start the timer and listen for the audio chime when it finishes. Once it's done, start the next timer when you're ready. No knowledge is necessary to use this timer, just pay attention to the time left!

timer_style.q: Which timer style should I use?
timer_style.a: That depends on how obscure you want the timer to be. Traditional looks like "12:34" (seconds-precision), approximate looks like "13 minutes" and percentage looks like "50%".

subtitle.main: AnotherPomodoro is being developed as a side project with no compensation in mind.
subtitle.action: If you feel that this is a project worth supporting, please do so.

preset.title: Application preset
preset.description: These presets enable certain functions in the app so that you can use it the way you feel comfortable.

timerpreset.title: Timer length
timerpreset.description: Choose a timer preset that you'd like to work with.

timerstyle.title: Timer display
timerstyle.description: AnotherPomodoro supports three timer styles ranging from seconds-precision to showing only a percentage.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: The app can play a sound and send a notification when a timer expires.

tip.title: Tip
tip.description: You'll find all the settings by clicking on the cog icon in the top right corner.

_valueDescription.minimalist: No distracting items, just a timer in the middle.
_valueDescription.default: The starter settings. Recommended for first time users.
_valueDescription.hardcore: Every feature is enabled so you can have everything in front of you.

settings.heading: Settings
settings.scheduleMinTime: The minimum allowed time is 5 seconds

about.supportBody: I develop AnotherPomodoro in my free time. It would mean a lot to me if you could help me keep working on it!
about.mobileSupport: Due to the rules enforced by the Google Play Store, I cannot show you any links inside the mobile app to donate to the project.
about.share: or share the app on social media:

manage._description: Download the current settings or load them from a file

sectionOver._description: Show a notification when a section is over

persistent._description: Display the progress of the current timer

enabled._description: Timer will tick less frequently while in the background

showSectionType._description: Displays the current section type under the schedule

audio._description: Let the app play sounds when a section is over

notifications._description: Let the app send you notifications when a section is over

enableKeyboardShortcuts._description: Start/pause the timer with the space key

enabled._description: Manage your work right from the app

maxActiveTasks._description: You'll only see this many active tasks at most

removeCompletedTasks._description: Tasks completed will be removed when a new section begins

reset._description: All settings will be reset after the app is reloaded

work.title: Time to get back to work!
work.body: Your break is over. Work some more, then rest again.

shortpause.title: Time for a break
shortpause.body: Nice, you've earned a short break.

longpause.title: Whew! More spare time!
longpause.body: Well-well. After working this much, you deserve a longer break.

error.min_time: The input time is too short

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.addPlaceholder: Enter something you need to do

action.home: Go back to the home page
action.githubDiscussion: Ask others if they have the same issue

showError.sub: I'll use it to report an issue or ask if others experience it, too.

_valueDescription.easy: For those who haven't yet tried the Pomodoro technique.

timerpreset.description:
{brief} 
 {worklength} minutes of work with {splength} minutes short and {lplength} minutes long breaks after every {lpfreq} work sessions.

0.title: Welcome to AnotherPomodoro!
0.text: Take a quick look around on how to use the app effectively.

1.title: Follow the clock
1.text: Work or take a break until the timer runs out. Then proceed with your next timer.

2.title: Rest regularly
2.text: Every few breaks you get more time to rest. Make good use of it.

3.title: Stay flexible
3.text: Set your own timers, use the task list and notifications to your advantage. Check out the settings menu for more opportunities!

support.title: Support the project
support.text: If this project helped you, consider inviting the author to a coffee. You can find the support button in the settings menu, too.
